question.text: Denaturation is a step in the procedure called Polymerase Chain Reaction. This step does not involve which of the following process?

options.text: Breaking of hydrogen bonds of the original DNA double helix
Addition of nucleotides to the primer by DNA polymerase

solution.text: PCR stands for Polymerase Chain Reaction. In this reaction, gene (segment of DNA) of interest is synthesized in vitro and multiple copies are generated. The main steps of PCR- Denaturation - where the double-stranded template DNA is heated to separate it into two single strands. Annealing - where the temperature is lowered to enable the DNA primers to attach to the template DNA. Extension - where the temperature is raised and the new strand of DNA is made by the Taq polymerase enzyme.
